agent_c_analysis.methodology_note: Cycle 11 is the FIRST rotation engine cycle. 42 rotation candidates evaluated alongside 10 existing pipeline signals and 6 new cross-domain synthesis signals. Two new kills issued (K-008, K-009). Three-layer framework validated with 0% rescue rate on kill re-scans. Rotation engine confirms existing pipeline is well-prioritized.
agent_c_analysis.rotation_engine_first_cycle_assessment: The Business Rotation Engine's systematic 6-channel scan of the US economy produced 42 candidates. After Agent A filtering: 25 quick kills, 12 parks, 3 subsumes, 2 new kills. ZERO new INVESTIGATE_FURTHER promotions. This is a STRONG VALIDATION of the existing pipeline — a systematic economy-wide scan could not find a better opportunity than Customer Support PURSUE. The rotation engine's primary value this cycle was CONFIRMATORY (cross-channel validation of vet services, kill re-scan framework validation, Zirtual thesis confirmation) rather than GENERATIVE (no new opportunities promoted). Calibration recommendations issued for future cycles.

graded_signals.headline: THREE-LAYER VALIDATION: 0 of 7 kills rescued. Framework is selective and reliable.
ROTATION ENGINE: 25 quick kills, 0 new INVESTIGATE_FURTHER. Existing pipeline confirmed as best available.
CROSS-DOMAIN: Failed startups attempted hard end first. Customer Support is correct entry point in propagation chain.
EXECUTION URGENCY: 10-16 month window, 12 months minimum execution. Must begin immediately.
ROTATION ENGINE: De-exclusivity channel independently confirms vet thesis. Cross-channel validation.
R-001/R-002/R-003: No trigger events. All risk levels unchanged.
METHODOLOGY: Baumol scanner needs credential-barrier filter. Tech/finance Baumol scores are artifacts.
CROSS-DOMAIN: P-010 Inversion Barrier most powerful in digital services, not physical ops.
ROTATION ENGINE: Channel quality assessment. De-exclusivity and Failure Archaeology highest value.
K-008 (Dental) and K-009 (Consulting) issued. Two opportunities escalated from PARKED to KILLED.

opportunity_clusters.name: Customer Support Vacuum Filler -- Managed Hybrid Human+AI
opportunity_clusters.thesis: AI-first managed customer support targeting SaaS mid-market (100-500 employees). AI handles 65% of tickets at near-zero marginal cost. LATAM human agents handle 35% complex/emotional escalations at 60% below US cost. Blended cost 60-67% below BPO incumbents. 30-40% gross margins. Service layer density <$500M. BPO incumbents structurally unable to invert. Triple convergence confirmed. Land-and-expand validated by failure archaeology (Zirtual thesis confirms IO propagation chain).
opportunity_clusters.score_change_rationale: No new information changes the score. Rotation engine provides CONFIRMATORY value (Zirtual failure archaeology validates IO propagation chain, three-layer framework validated with 0% rescue rate on kills) but no new data that would alter the scoring dimensions. R-001/R-002/R-003 monitoring shows no trigger events. Score maintained at 72 in execution phase. Note: Agent B's Cycle 10 scoring was 72 (discounted from Agent C's 75). We maintain Agent B's score.

pursue_criteria_assessment.no_kill_barrier: PASS -- no regulatory prohibition, no precedent failure at 100x+ capital in managed service layer
pursue_criteria_assessment.positive_unit_economics: PASS -- 30-40% gross margin modeled, break-even at 5-8 clients
pursue_criteria_assessment.sparse_density: PASS -- <$500M in AI-first managed service layer (tool $5B+ is distinct market)
pursue_criteria_assessment.timing_window: PASS -- 10-16 months (Agent B), 12-18 months (Agent C). Sufficient but TIGHT.
pursue_criteria_assessment.founder_fit: PASS -- operator + ML engineer. Argentina citizen enables LATAM talent pipeline. No credentials needed.
pursue_criteria_assessment.beachhead_identified: PASS -- SaaS mid-market (100-500 emp), $5K-30K/month WTP, 2-4 week sales cycle
pursue_criteria_assessment.cross_signal_reinforcement: PASS -- triple convergence (Beveridge + equity + timing). Now QUADRUPLE with failure archaeology (Zirtual validates).

opportunity_clusters.kill_index_risk: LOW -- no trigger events on R-001, R-002, R-003
counter_signals: R-001: Sierra AI pivot to managed mid-market (10-15%, unchanged)
R-002: Autonomous agent rapid maturation (20-30%, unchanged)
Incumbent BPO AI adoption continues (hidden density metric)

Rotation engine economy-wide scan found NOTHING more promising -- strongest possible validation of pipeline ranking
P-010 refinement: inversion barrier most powerful in digital services (confirms Customer Support advantage over physical ops candidates)

opportunity_clusters.name: Veterinary Services -- Agentic Practice Operations
opportunity_clusters.thesis: AI-powered practice operations software for 33K independent vet practices. Legacy PIMS (Cornerstone, Avimark) are 15-20 years old. Archy ($47M) is lone modern entrant. Mars/IDEXX NOT building practice ops AI (resolved Cycle 10). Competitive density <$100M (sparsest in pipeline). Now cross-channel validated by rotation engine de-exclusivity scanner. Software-only model at $500K seed, practice acquisition at Series A.
opportunity_clusters.score_change_rationale: +1 for cross-channel validation. Rotation engine's regulatory de-exclusivity channel independently identified vet services via DVM license barrier. This is the SECOND independent discovery method confirming the opportunity (first: bottom-up sector screen Cycle 7). Per cross-signal reinforcement weighting criteria, independent cross-channel confirmation merits +1. No other scoring dimensions changed.

pursue_criteria_assessment.positive_unit_economics: PARTIAL -- software TAM $297M modeled, but no customer validation yet
pursue_criteria_assessment.sparse_density: PASS -- <$100M in AI vet ops (sparsest in entire pipeline)
pursue_criteria_assessment.timing_window: PASS -- no imminent window close unless Mars acquires Archy
pursue_criteria_assessment.founder_fit: PARTIAL -- ML expertise relevant, but no veterinary domain knowledge
pursue_criteria_assessment.beachhead_identified: PARTIAL -- independent practices (33K), but no customer validation
pursue_criteria_assessment.cross_signal_reinforcement: PASS (new) -- bottom-up sector screen + rotation engine de-exclusivity channel = 2 independent methods

State licensing map for non-vet practice ownership

new_cycle_11_evidence: Cross-channel validation: de-exclusivity channel independently flagged vet services (DVM license barrier)
Rotation engine economy-wide scan confirms vet's <$100M density is genuinely exceptional

opportunity_clusters.name: Wholesale Trade AI Broker -- NAICS 425120
opportunity_clusters.thesis: AI-powered broker replacement for wholesale trade agents. 512K employees, 122K firms, 4.2 avg. K-004 freight kill does NOT apply (4/6 dimensions distinct). Commodity chemicals identified as optimal vertical. Knowde ($120M) exists but as marketplace, not broker replacement.
opportunity_clusters.score_change_rationale: No new information changes the score. Rotation engine did not produce additional wholesale trade signals. Customer discovery deadline (Cycle 12) remains the hard decision point. PARK WARNING continues.

pursue_criteria_assessment.no_kill_barrier: PASS (conditional) -- K-004 distinction memo convincing on 4/6 dimensions

pursue_criteria_assessment.beachhead_identified: PARTIAL -- commodity chemicals identified but not validated
pursue_criteria_assessment.cross_signal_reinforcement: WEAK -- only one method (bottom-up screen) identified this

opportunity_clusters.kill_index_risk: MEDIUM -- cold-start problem, Knowde adjacency, relationship stickiness unknown
opportunity_clusters.park_trigger: No customer discovery by Cycle 12 = PARK. This is the FINAL cycle before deadline.
opportunity_clusters.decision_required: CYCLE 12: Customer discovery with 3-5 commodity chemical brokers OR PARK.

new_kills_this_cycle.name: Dental Practice Operations AI
new_kills_this_cycle.kill_reason: Three-layer analysis confirms all layers occupied: Dentrix/Eaglesoft (tool), DSO consolidators (service), Pearl AI $100M+ (AI-native). 38-state regulatory barrier for non-dentist ownership. Poor founder fit. Three-layer re-scan via rotation engine kill channel confirms no sparse layer.
new_kills_this_cycle.preserved_insight: Dental practice operations IS ripe for AI disruption. But DSO consolidators (Aspen Dental 1000+ offices) are already investing in tech, Pearl AI is well-funded in imaging, and state regulations restrict non-dentist entry. Only viable if founders had DDS + tech background.

new_kills_this_cycle.name: Boutique Management Consulting Replacement
new_kills_this_cycle.kill_reason: Cycle 12 deadline reached (set in Cycle 9). Three-layer confirms no sparse layer: every AI company positions as 'consultant replacement.' $10B+ across all layers (MBB + Big 4 + specialized AI consulting). No specific standardized vertical identified in 3 cycles of parked status. Most competitive thesis in existence.
new_kills_this_cycle.preserved_insight: AI IS replacing aspects of management consulting. But the disruption is being driven by MBB firms themselves (McKinsey Lilli), Big 4 ($B+ AI investments), and horizontal AI tools (ChatGPT/Claude used ad-hoc). No room for a $500K entrant in the most analyzed AI thesis in the market.

cross_signal_patterns.name: Rotation Engine Economy-Wide Validation of Pipeline Ranking
cross_signal_patterns.description: The Business Rotation Engine's systematic 6-channel scan of the entire US economy (42 candidates across Baumol inversion, kill re-scan, physical ops, VC anti-portfolio, regulatory de-exclusivity, and failure archaeology) produced ZERO new opportunities that rank higher than the existing pipeline. This is the strongest possible validation that the engine's current ranking (Customer Support > Vet > Wholesale) is correct.
cross_signal_patterns.interpretation: When you systematically scan the entire economy and find nothing better than what you already have, the existing pipeline is validated. The rotation engine's value this cycle was confirmatory, not generative.
cross_signal_patterns.strategic_implication: Stop searching for alternatives. Execute on Customer Support PURSUE. The economy-wide scan confirms there is nothing better available.

cross_signal_patterns.name: Three-Layer Framework Selectivity Validated -- 0% Kill Rescue Rate
cross_signal_patterns.description: All 7 killed opportunities re-scanned through the three-layer competitive framework. Zero were rescued. The framework correctly identifies sparse service layers ONLY where they genuinely exist (customer support <$500M, vet <$100M). This 0% false positive rate provides high confidence in the framework's findings.
cross_signal_patterns.interpretation: The three-layer framework is not just finding what we want it to find. It is genuinely selective. When it identifies a sparse service layer, that finding is reliable.
cross_signal_patterns.strategic_implication: Three-layer framework should be the standard competitive density analysis for all future opportunities.

cross_signal_patterns.name: Failure Archaeology Validates IO Propagation Chain
cross_signal_patterns.description: Failed startups from 2014-2018 (Homejoy, Washio, Shyp, Zirtual, Cherry) attempted coordination-cost businesses starting at the HARD end (physical ops). The IO propagation chain predicts the correct sequence: digital-pure (customer support) -> semi-digital (admin/VA) -> physical (cleaning/logistics). Zirtual's failure on human VA costs is structurally identical to the Customer Support thesis — AI inverts the cost structure.
cross_signal_patterns.interpretation: Historical startup failure patterns independently validate the IO propagation chain and the decision to enter at the digital-pure end. Customer Support is not just analytically correct — it is historically validated as the correct entry point.
cross_signal_patterns.strategic_implication: The land-and-expand strategy (customer support -> admin/VA -> sales ops -> account management) follows the correct difficulty gradient. Build digital-first, expand to semi-digital, defer physical.

cross_signal_patterns.name: Baumol Scanner Systematic Bias Identified -- Calibration Needed
cross_signal_patterns.description: The Baumol inversion channel's top picks are ALL quick-killed because high pay in tech/finance reflects talent competition, not Baumol cost disease. True Baumol stored energy requires credential-barrier protection (regulatory de-exclusivity). The Baumol x De-exclusivity intersection is more accurate than either channel alone.
cross_signal_patterns.interpretation: The rotation engine's channels interact. Baumol alone overfits to tech/finance. De-exclusivity alone overfits to regulated professions. The intersection identifies sectors with genuine stored energy PROTECTED by credential barriers — exactly where AI can unlock value.
cross_signal_patterns.strategic_implication: For Cycle 12 rotation, weight Baumol x De-exclusivity intersection, not raw Baumol score. Add credential-barrier filter to Baumol channel.

cross_signal_patterns.name: P-010 Inversion Barrier Domain Specificity -- Digital > Physical
cross_signal_patterns.description: The BPO structural inversion barrier (P-010) is most powerful in DIGITAL service categories where startup unit economics work at small scale. In physical operations, startups die on unit economics before reaching the scale where incumbent inversion barriers matter. P-010 is a DIGITAL-services pattern, not a universal pattern.
cross_signal_patterns.interpretation: P-010 correctly predicts that BPO firms (Concentrix, TTEC, Teleperformance) cannot invert to AI-first. But it does NOT predict that construction firms, cleaning companies, or logistics providers cannot invert — because startups in those sectors fail on unit economics first.
cross_signal_patterns.strategic_implication: Apply P-010 only to digital/semi-digital service opportunities. Do not rely on inversion barrier for physical ops opportunities.

engine_health.status: CONFIRMATORY CYCLE -- Rotation engine validates pipeline, finds no alternatives
engine_health.assessment: Cycle 11 is the first rotation engine cycle. The systematic 6-channel economy-wide scan confirms that Customer Support PURSUE is the best available opportunity. The rotation engine's primary value was confirmatory: cross-channel validation of vet services, kill re-scan framework validation, failure archaeology thesis confirmation, and methodology calibration insights. Two new kills issued (K-008 dental, K-009 consulting) as parked opportunities exceeded their deadlines. The engine is now FULLY in Phase 2 (execution support). The search phase is complete. Every systematic method — brainstorming (Cycles 1-3), bottom-up screening (Cycles 4-7), IO propagation (Cycle 10), and rotation engine (Cycle 11) — converges on the same pipeline ranking.
engine_health.key_risk: EXECUTION RISK is now the dominant risk. The analytical phase is conclusive. The timing window (10-16 months) demands immediate execution. Every cycle spent in analysis mode narrows the window.
methodology_innovations_this_cycle: Rotation engine first application: 6-channel systematic scan of US economy (42 candidates)
Three-layer framework validation: 0/7 kill rescue rate confirms selectivity
Baumol calibration insight: tech/finance bias identified, credential-barrier filter recommended
P-010 domain specificity: inversion barrier applies to digital services, not physical ops
Failure archaeology x IO propagation: historical failures validate correct entry sequencing

recommendations_for_cycle_12.action: EXECUTE Customer Support Vacuum -- This Is Now Urgent
recommendations_for_cycle_12.description: Every analytical method has converged. The rotation engine economy-wide scan found nothing better. 10-16 month window is ticking. Build MVP. Recruit LATAM agents. Sign pilot customers. The engine has done its job. Execution is now the only remaining variable.

5-10 vet practice owner conversations. This is the ONLY remaining blocker to PURSUE recommendation. Cross-channel validation (de-exclusivity) strengthens conviction. Customer discovery must happen in Cycle 12 or vet stalls permanently.

recommendations_for_cycle_12.action: Wholesale Trade: Customer Discovery or PARK
recommendations_for_cycle_12.description: HARD DEADLINE reached. Interview 3-5 commodity chemical brokers about relationship dynamics and Knowde usage. If relationships are sticky (like freight), PARK. If transactional, maintain INVESTIGATE. No discovery = PARK.

Apply Baumol credential-barrier filter. Weight de-exclusivity and failure archaeology channels higher. De-weight Baumol and VC anti-portfolio channels. Add Baumol x De-exclusivity intersection as composite channel.
Web tools unavailable Cycles 10-11. When available, immediately check: Sierra AI positioning (R-001), autonomous agent benchmarks (R-002), Mars/Archy news (R-003), Knowde penetration data.

Add K-008 (dental) and K-009 (consulting) to kill index. Add 6 new parks from rotation engine. Update total evaluated count to 30. Update running patterns with P-010 domain specificity and Baumol calibration findings.
